poem:
Title: "In the Shadows of Voices"

A funder's cruel phrase, ink-blotted,
Tossed like a grim pebble, oddly spotted.
A tower in No. 10, its shade shifting,
Addressing wrongs, in responsibility sifting.
Sunak caught in the crossfire, history writ,
While Hester's remarks sit, ill-fit.
Voices congregate, heart heavy, protest loud,
A murky meeting draped in a thunderous cloud.
